fields.headline: Corrections and clarifications
fields.bodyText: • The rugby coach Carwyn James was 41, not 31, when he led the British and Irish Lions to win the Test series against the All Blacks in 1971. The caption to an accompanying picture said the fly-half Barry John was shown second right. He was on the far right of that picture (Carwyn James’ vision showed the way forward, 10 June, page 6, Sport). • The display of umbrellas as seen in a photograph on the letters page (Shelter from the storm, 7 June, page 28) was not set up by umbrella sellers outside Bath station, as the caption suggested. While the shot was taken on a showery day, the colourful umbrella formation is part of an installation in the city. • Homophone corner: “They were delighted to have the extensive archive as part of the collection, and said it complimented other recent donations” (Palin’s gift to the nation reveals the comic birth of Brian and Mr Creosote, 14 June, page 5). • Other recently corrected articles include: Katy v Taylor, Nicki v Remy: why pop star bust-ups diminish all women
